definition: to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: The subject of his sermon was charity.
sentences.chinese: 他頗有口才，講題是“慈善”。

sentences.english: His long lecture confused about the topic.
sentences.chinese: 他的長篇演講把講題都弄混了。

sentences.english: Anyway, we can discuss that in great detail when you've got your subject chosen.
sentences.chinese: 總之，等選定講題後可以進一步探討。

sentences.english: You should be working on the last question by now.
sentences.chinese: 目下現古您們該當正在做末了一講題了。

sentences.english: He was tolerably eloquent. The subject of his sermon was charity.
sentences.chinese: 他頗有口才，講題是“慈善”。

sentences.english: This section provides the course's lecture topics and corresponding reading assignments.
sentences.chinese: 此部份提供課程講稿的講題及對應的閱讀分派。

sentences.english: Perhaps the most neglected part of any speech is the title.
sentences.chinese: 講題，或許是每篇演講最常被忽略的部分。

definition: (Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
dummy run/to run through sth/to rehearse
Yangdong county in Yangjiang 陽江|阳江[Yang2 jiang1], Guangdong
Fushun prefecture-level city in Liaoning province 遼寧省|辽宁省 in northeast China
Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties/generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui
